name: CbcNodeInfo
brief: Persistent information for recreating search tree nodes

algorithms.name:
Search Tree Node Reconstruction with Reference Counting
Copyright (C) 2002, IBM Corporation and others. All Rights Reserved.
This code is licensed under the terms of the Eclipse Public License (EPL).

CbcNodeInfo stores information to reconstruct a subproblem:
- Warm start basis
- Variable bound changes
- Cutting planes added at this node
- Parent linkage and reference counting

Two flavors:
- CbcFullNodeInfo: Complete state (used at root)
- CbcPartialNodeInfo: Differences from parent (saves memory)

Reference counting: Sum of potential + actual children.
Node deleted when count reaches zero (subtree pruned).

see:
CbcPartialNodeInfo for incremental storage

Edwin 11/24/09 carved from CbcNode
